p: When control mortality did not exceed 20%, the Abbottâ€™s formula [ 60] was applied to correct experimental mortality rates. If control mortality was >20%, experiments were not considered and repeated. LD 50(90) or LC 50(90) for the targeted organisms, with associated 95% CL and chi-square values, were calculated using probit analysis [ 61]. The concentration of BEO causing 50% AChE inhibition (IC 50) was calculated via nonlinear regression analysis.
